monogr.title: A discourse of a discouerie for a new passage to Cataia : VVritten by Sir Humfrey Gilbert, knight
monogr.author: Gilbert, Humphrey, Sir

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: A PROPHETICAL SOnet of the same George Gascoine, vpon the commendable trauaile which Sir Humfrey Gilbert hath disclosed in this worke.

lg.l: Men praise Columbus for the passing skil
And nam'd him first (as yet we cal him stil)
Neptune the 3. ful worthely was named,
And Magellanus, by good right did gaine,
Neptune the 4. ful fitly to be famed.
But al those three, and al the world beside,
Discouered not, a thing of more emprice,
Then in this booke, is learnedly descride,
By vertue of my worthie friendes deuice.
Yf such successe, to him (as them) then fall,
Neptune the 5. we iustly may him call.
